summary: This mod makes the faces of almost all characters the player can marry much more pleasant to look at by making minor changes to the shape of their faces. While they still remain themselves.
descriptionHtml:
This file can also be found on the Steam Workshop.

This mod changes some of the proportions of the faces of the NPC available for marriage to the player. This makes their faces a lot more pleasant to look at. Many of the characters look more friendly than they did before, something Bethesda had missed. I mean, no one wants to marry a cranky person, right? This was achieved mainly by elevating the eyebrows slightly.
Some of the characters also have the shapes of their eyes and/or noses altered to fit better with the new proportions or to take away the feeling of them trying to spot a lie in your words all the time. Like I had with Jordis, her eyes were always peeled, as if she didn’t trust me…

Many of the male characters available for marriage were all very dirty. And while I’m not a woman, I can very much imagine them being reluctant of marrying a very dirty, smelly pig. So what I did was, I cleaned them up a bit. Some characters still have some dirt on their face (like blacksmiths and miners), but they also seem a bit less dirty. For instance, I sometimes changed the colour of the dirt to make it seem less dirty.

I kept in mind that all these characters are different, so I made sure that I still kept the general outlines of the faces so that you still have the same “feel” with the characters, though I did take away the war paint with Mjoll the Lioness (while still keeping her scars) and with Aela the Huntress, mainly because these covered their faces to such an extent that they masked their own beauty entirely.

If you have any questions, remarks, ideas or suggestions, I will be checking this page regularly.

V1.1:
Tweaked NPCs:

Women:
Iona
Jordis the Sword-Maiden
Lydia
Ysolda

Men:
Farkas
Octieve San
